detaileddescription.para: Produces an unbound Expression with the same structure, but with data values replaced by descriptions.
Numbers are replaced with magnitude and type, string-like values are replaced by hashes, and date/time values are replaced by the type.
Produces an unbound Expression with the same structure, but with data values replaced by descriptions.
Numbers are replaced with magnitude and type, string-like values are replaced by hashes, and date/time values are replaced by the type.

parameterdescription.para: a StructType to bind the expression

detaileddescription.para: Produces a sanitized expression string with the same structure, but with data values replaced by descriptions.
Numbers are replaced with magnitude and type, string-like values are replaced by hashes, and date/time values are replaced by the type.
Produces a sanitized expression string with the same structure, but with data values replaced by descriptions.
Numbers are replaced with magnitude and type, string-like values are replaced by hashes, and date/time values are replaced by the type.

parameterdescription.para: a StructType to bind the expression

memberdef.argsstring: (Expression expression, Schema schema, boolean caseSensitive, int... ids)
memberdef.name: extractByIdInclusive

detaileddescription.para: Extracts an expression that references only the given column IDs from the given expression.
The result is inclusive. If a row would match the original filter, it must match the result filter.

parameterdescription.para: field IDs used to match predicates to extract from the expression

simplesect.para: an Expression that selects at least the same rows as the original using only the IDs

memberdef.argsstring: (Expression left, Expression right, Types.StructType struct, boolean caseSensitive)
memberdef.name: equivalent

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether two unbound expressions will accept the same inputs.

If this returns true, the expressions are guaranteed to return the same evaluation for the same input. However, if this returns false the expressions may return the same evaluation for the same input. That is, expressions may be equivalent even if this returns false.

parameterdescription.para: whether to bind expressions using case-sensitive matching

simplesect.para: true if the expressions are equivalent

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether an expression selects whole partitions for all partition specs in a table.
For example, ts < '2021-03-09T10:00:00.000' selects whole partitions in an hourly spec, [hours(ts)], but does not select whole partitions in a daily spec, [days(ts)].

parameterdescription.para: whether expression binding should be case sensitive

simplesect.para: true if the expression will select whole partitions in all table specs

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether an expression selects whole partitions for a partition spec.
For example, ts < '2021-03-09T10:00:00.000' selects whole partitions in an hourly spec, [hours(ts)], but does not select whole partitions in a daily spec, [days(ts)].

simplesect.para: true if the expression will select whole partitions in the given spec

memberdef.argsstring: (Type type, Object value, long now, int today)
memberdef.name: sanitize
